intro: Dahuronia, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the cold climates of eastern Asia, particularly Russia and China. The plants typically feature showy blue or purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Dahuronia species are perennial herbs with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and alpine settings.
